title: Kenai Fjords National Park: "Park Profiles" Series
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     "Park Profiles" Series                Park Profiles       This series of videos highlights a few of the jobs and opportunities available within the National Park Service, and at Kenai Fjords National Park specifically.  The videos were produced by media interns for the Ocean Alaska Science and Learning Center, based here in Kenai Fjords. If you were ever interested what it is like to be a park ranger, this series is for you!                        Park Profile: Captain of the M/V Serac Captain Melissa Knight describes her life on the water, piloting the primary vessel for Kenai Fjords National Park.  Duration:3 minutes, 8 seconds                                Park Profiles: Resource Management So you want to be a Park Ranger? Environmental Protection Specialist Christina Kriedeman describes how she works to protect natural resources, and what inspires her to work in a national park.  Duration:2 minutes, 45 seconds                                Park Profiles: Youth Conservation Corps (YCC) Josh Eavis describes what it's like to work as a part of the Youth Conservation Corps (YCC), with the Division of Interpretation & Education at Kenai Fjords National Park.  Duration:1 minute, 56 seconds                                Park Profiles: Interpretation Park Ranger Katie Peck describes what it's like to work as an interpreter at Kenai Fjords National Park.  Duration:2 minutes, 21 seconds                                Park Profiles: Visitor and Resource Protection (VRP) Park Ranger Joshua Van Aalst describes what it's like to work at Kenai Fjords National Park.  Duration:3 minutes
